weather_report:
As night gives way to dawn in Evanston, the scene is set under a canopy of mostly cloudy skies, while a brisk northwest wind carries the chill of early November. The temperature hovers around 40 degrees, suggesting a layer or two would be wise for anyone venturing out. The promise of Friday brings clearer skies and warmth only in comparison to the night preceding it, with a high peeking near 51 degrees. While the clouds are expected to clear, the air retains an autumnal crispness.

The waves on Lake Michigan appear calm, though the winds maintain a slight bite, hinting at seasonal transitions. The waterfront path beckons for a serene stroll, albeit more appealing for those equipped with gloves and warm jackets than for a leisurely beach outing in the sun. Individuals might find themselves enjoying a walk or a hot coffee from a local café, rather than spending time directly by the water. As today is the first day of November, this moment reflects the quieter, reflective mood of the season as the world begins its descent into winter. Those looking for comfort might find solace in cozy indoor activities, perhaps curling up with a book or revisiting those cherished autumn films.
